== Ubuntu Documentation Maintenance ==
I have started tagging everything on <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community]]</nowiki>
I do that with these tags: <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Tag]]</nowiki>
Besides marking them I also make sure every page has a category: <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/CategoryCategory]]</nowiki>

== What should be improved ==
=== Pages marked for Deletion ===
* Check if there is any comment in the page
* Does the information exists elsewhere ?
* Does it belong to a loco ? send them the content ...
* is it outdated and/or unsupported, do we want to keep it for historic reasons ?

=== Pages marked Duplicate ===
* Check if there is any comment in the page
* Does the information exists elsewhere ? Look at page names.

=== Pages marked Unsupported ===
* Check if there is any comment in the page
* Do we want to keep it for historic reasons ?

=== Pages marked for Moving ===
* Check if there is any comment in the page
* Does a similar page name exist on the same wiki ?
* Does it belong on wiki.ubuntu.com ?

=== Pages marked Too long ===
* Check if there is any comment in the page
* What would be a reasonable way to split the pages ?

=== Pages marked for Content cleanup ===
* Check if there is any comment in the page
* Mind that we still support 9.04
* page talk should be removed from the page
* Is the information still relevant ?
* Should the page be rewritten less personal, more professional ?

=== Pages marked for Style cleanup ===
* Check if there is any comment in the page
* Concise page chapters and bullets

=== Pages marked for Needs Expansion ===
* Check if there is any comment in the page
* Search if there is more relevant information available to this topic
